messageBody:
> -----Original Message-----
> From: ca_dr98 [mailto:ca_dr98@...]
>
> Can any one give me sample code of how to run JFCUnit??


I've used JFCUnit a little bit. Here are some test methods I wrote:

private Component assertNotNullAndShowing(String name, Container
container, int index)
{
Component component = m_helper.findNamedComponent(name,
container, index);
assertNotNull("Could not find " + name, component);
assertTrue(name + " is not showing", component.isShowing());

return component;
}

public void testComponents()
{
//Check to make sure all the visible components are showing.

assertNotNullAndShowing("AddButton", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("DeleteButton", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("ConnectButton", m_dialog, 0);

assertNotNullAndShowing("SelectADeviceLabel", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("ScrollPane", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("Table", m_dialog, 0);

assertNotNullAndShowing("Separator", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("AccessLevel", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("GuestRadio", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("OperatorRadio", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("AdministratorRadio", m_dialog, 0);

assertNotNullAndShowing("PasswordLabel", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNullAndShowing("PasswordField", m_dialog, 0);
}

public void testAddClick() throws Exception
{
JButton addButton =
(JButton)m_helper.findNamedComponent("AddButton", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNull("Could not find the Add button", addButton);

m_helper.enterClickAndLeave(new MouseEventData(this,
addButton));

//verify that the add dialog is shown.
//then close it.
java.util.List showingDialogs = m_helper.getShowingDialogs("Add
Device");
assertEquals("Number of dialogs showing is wrong", 1,
showingDialogs.size());

JDialog addDialog = ( JDialog )showingDialogs.get( 0 );
assertEquals("Wrong dialog showing up", "Add Device",
addDialog.getTitle());
m_helper.disposeWindow(addDialog, this);
}

public void testAddOneDevice() throws Exception
{
JButton addButton =
(JButton)m_helper.findNamedComponent("AddButton", m_dialog, 0);
assertNotNull("Could not find the Add button", addButton);

m_helper.enterClickAndLeave(new MouseEventData(this,
addButton));

//verify that the add dialog is shown.
//then close it.
java.util.List showingDialogs = m_helper.getShowingDialogs("Add
Device");
assertEquals("Number of dialogs showing is wrong", 1,
showingDialogs.size());

JDialog addDialog = ( JDialog )showingDialogs.get( 0 );
assertEquals("Wrong dialog showing up", "Add Device",
addDialog.getTitle());

//get the text fields
JTextField deviceNameField =
(JTextField)assertNotNullAndShowing("DeviceNameField", addDialog, 0);
JTextField addressField =
(JTextField)assertNotNullAndShowing("AddressField", addDialog, 0);
JButton addButton2 =
(JButton)assertNotNullAndShowing("AddButton", addDialog, 0);

//put text in the text fields.
deviceNameField.requestFocus();
m_helper.sendString(new StringEventData(this, deviceNameField,
"TestDeviceName"));

addressField.requestFocus();
m_helper.sendString(new StringEventData(this, addressField,
"TestDeviceAddress"));

//then click the add button.
m_helper.enterClickAndLeave(new MouseEventData(this,
addButton2));

//verify that the dialog closed.
showingDialogs = m_helper.getShowingDialogs("Add Device");
assertEquals("Number of dialogs showing is wrong", 0,
showingDialogs.size());

//verify that the item was added to the table.
//get the table
JTable table = (JTable)assertNotNullAndShowing("Table",
m_dialog, 0);
TableModel model = table.getTableModel();
int rowCount = model.getRowCount();
assertTrue(rowCount >= 1);

String name = (String)model.getValueAt(rowCount-1, 0);
String address = (String)model.getValueAt(rowCount-1, 1);

assertEquals(name, "TestDeviceName");
assertEquals(address, "TestDeviceAddress");
}

Hope this helps,

Kris
